sentences.chinese: 奧德耶諾將軍讚揚了這一事態進展。

sentences.english: When push comes to shove， only your true friends will still stand by you.
sentences.chinese: 當事態嚴重時，只有真正的朋友還會支持你。

sentences.english: As things stand, the answer to both questions is no.
sentences.chinese: 隨着事態的發展，對這兩個問題的回答是不。

sentences.english: I know that things are tough for you now, but try to keep a stiff upper lip .
sentences.chinese: 我知道現在對你來說事態很嚴峻，但你要頑強不屈。

sentences.english: It is in vain, sir, to extenuate the matter.
sentences.chinese: 試圖低估事態的嚴重性是枉然的。

sentences.english: It is urgent that just immedihpost measures should guarinitiing ould likeeedficevery one of they get to stop thesituine.
sentences.chinese: 很緊迫的是應隨即採取措施阻止這一事態的發達。

sentences.english: Bad news , , , authorities should look in the matter , , , , , its serious.
sentences.chinese: 壞消息，當局應該調查此事，事態嚴重。

sentences.english: After what happened, China and Myanmar have kept close communication.
sentences.chinese: 事態發生以後，中緬雙方保持着密切溝通。

sentences.english: Do more reading about the materials of" Past forms".
sentences.chinese: 多讀關於過去事態的文章。

sentences.english: Denunciations will only grow more strident.
sentences.chinese: 譴責只會讓事態變得更加尖銳。

sentences.english: Many realists feel that it is possible at least to allay the tensions it breeds.
sentences.chinese: 許多現實的人則認爲事態至少會被緩解。

sentences.english: So she had blood-kin under her roof again and we sat back to watch developments.
sentences.chinese: 原來她家裏還有近親，於是我們坐待事態的發展。

sentences.english: Seventeen months later, things have only gotten worse.
sentences.chinese: 17個月過去了，事態只是越變越遭。

sentences.english: They will assess the situation together and review needs for further support.
sentences.chinese: 他們將共同評估事態和審查進一步支持的需求。

sentences.english: The incident woke them to the gravity of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 那個事件使他們意識到事態嚴重。

sentences.english: The club took the incident very seriously and is stepping up security at its two racecourses .
sentences.chinese: 馬會認爲事態嚴重，並加強兩個馬場的保安措施。

definition: to confer/to discuss/to engage in talks
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
to face squarely/to meet head on/to face up to
